Begin.title: Hunt-Hess Classification of Aneurysmal Subarachnoid Hemorrhage
Begin.explanation:
Hunt and Hess Classification
  • Grade 1. Asymptomatic, mild headache, slight nuchal rigidity
  • Grade 2. Moderate to severe headache, nuchal rigidity, no neurologic deficit other than cranial nerve palsy
  • Grade 3. Drowsiness / confusion, mild focal neurologic deficit
  • Grade 4. Stupor, moderate-severe hemiparesis
  • Grade 5. Coma, decerebrate posturing
    • Notes:
  • An alternative scale is the World Federation Neurological Scale
  • It is common to report the Fisher Group (amount and location of subarachnoid blood) when discussing the severity of the SAH
